TCNJ Home / Explore Programs / Criminology

Criminology

Degree

BA in Criminology

School

Humanities and Social Sciences

Department

Criminology

At a Glance

Study crime and its social contexts at TCNJ, which Niche ranked among the top 10% of the nation’s best colleges for criminal justice. You’ll gain a thorough understanding of the social science of criminology as well as the tools, methods, and institutions deployed across the criminal justice system. Our innovative curriculum is led by faculty who offer close mentorship and bring expertise and experience — in areas ranging from policing to policymaking — to the classroom. When you graduate, you’ll be more than ready to succeed in a range of criminal justice careers or at a top graduate school.

ApplyRequest Info

Undergraduate Program Options

MAJOR

Criminology, BA

THREE-YEAR OPTION

Criminology Three-Year Bachelor’s Degree

MINORS

Criminology Minor

Quantitative Criminology Minor

Accelerated/Dual-Degree Program Options

Get a jumpstart and enter the workforce with a master’s or professional degree. Accelerated options get you there faster and more affordably through fewer semesters of classes. Dual degrees offer a streamlined path to earning two degrees, often with direct admission to the graduate portion.

LAW

Criminology + Law, BA/JD

Third-year juniors may follow a six-year (3+3) accelerated pathway, and graduating seniors may follow a seven-year (4+3) traditional pathway to gain direct admission to law school in this highly selective dual-degree program with Villanova University’s Charles Widger School of Law.

You’ll Benefit From:

  • Exposure to graduate-level course content
  • Advanced instruction in the analysis of geospatial crime and data management
  • A flexible curriculum to customize your studies and earn a dual degree if desired
  • The option to pursue a second major in biology, chemistry, psychology, international studies, or statistics
  • Experiential learning and real-world application
  • Opportunities for internships, study abroad, and community engagement
  • Small classes and engagement with expert faculty

Careers

As a TCNJ criminology graduate, you’ll have the critical thinking, communications, and analytical skills to pursue a breadth of criminal justice careers in the public and private sector — or to further your studies through the nation’s top law or graduate criminology programs.

The Prelaw Program offers outstanding advising and curricular/extracurricular opportunities to students interested in a legal career.

Recent Employers

  • Critical Response Group
  • FBI
  • Isles
  • New Jersey Reentry Corporation
  • New Jersey State Commission of Investigation

Recent Graduate Schools

  • California State University, Chico
  • George Mason University
  • John Jay College of Criminal Justice
  • University of Delaware
  • University of Pennsylvania

Internships

TCNJ criminology students have interned with impressive federal, state, and local government organizations as well as with nonprofits and private companies.

The possibilities are wide-ranging; students have recently interned at the likes of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives; the Centurion County Prosecutor’s Office; the Drug Enforcement Administration; the FBI; ISLES Local Law Enforcement Agencies; the New Jersey Department of Corrections; the New Jersey Office of Homeland Security and Preparedness; the New Jersey State Police; and the U.S. Marshals.

Experiential Learning

In addition to internships and hands-on classroom learning, you can pursue an independent study or engage in faculty-led research. You might even have the opportunity to publish in a peer-reviewed journal or present at a conference.

Faculty 

TCNJ criminology faculty are committed to supporting our students and their future paths by bringing their expertise, wisdom, and experience — in areas ranging from policing to policymaking — to the classroom and beyond. Each student has a faculty mentor to help guide and advise them throughout the program.
